feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student demonstrates a functioning financial application that performs core financial tasks (loan entry, repayment-plan generation, payoff dates, and interest comparisons) with concrete numeric output, showing both conceptual and applied functionality (Discover + Implement). The added credit-score feature and validation steps further support a complete, working financial tool, meeting PASS-level thoroughness.
- Integrate AI: The student demonstrates clear, effective AI integration: they used Google AI Studio to implement an AI advisor that decomposes goals, generates repayment strategies, and produces specific numeric outputs (months, interest saved). The presence of implementation details, example outputs, and an evolved feature (credit-score impact) show thorough, functional use of AI rather than superficial mention.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "All you have to do here is hit generate plan. And what will happen is it's going to break down some of our um numbers and everything of what we should do and payoff dates."
"The problem is that users have multiple loan credit card student and car loans and don't know the most effective way to pay them down faster and the minimum required schedule."
"the avalanche method saves you the most money in total interest. So, it would be $4,925.14, which is $153.32 less than the snowball method."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: defined the multi-loan repayment problem and project goal.  
Implement: built "debt flow" in Google AI Studio, added loans, and used "generate plan" to produce repayment schedules.  
Evolve/Reflect: added a credit-score indicator and validated simulation results.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates a functioning financial application that performs core financial tasks (loan entry, repayment-plan generation, payoff dates, and interest comparisons) with concrete numeric output, showing both conceptual and applied functionality (Discover + Implement). The added credit-score feature and validation steps further support a complete, working financial tool, meeting PASS-level thoroughness.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "So we're going to go ahead and go on over to our um Google AI studio. Um so essentially this is what I made. It's called debt flow."

"The AI role in this was to decompose a problem into two competing goals the lowest total cost versus the fastest psychological wins and then to use a calculated data to recommend a specific strategy."

"So the verdict is essentially you're going to use both of the snowball and the avalanche uh methods. That's going to be a 64 months, but the avalanche method saves you the most money. ... it would be $4,925.14, which is $153.32 less than the snowball method."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover — identified a real user problem and defined AI's role in decomposing competing goals; Implement — built the tool in Google AI Studio and demonstrated the "generate plan" AI feature producing concrete recommendations and numbers; Evolve/Reflect — added a credit-score indicator and validated simulation outputs, showing iterative AI-driven refinement.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates clear, effective AI integration: they used Google AI Studio to implement an AI advisor that decomposes goals, generates repayment strategies, and produces specific numeric outputs (months, interest saved). The presence of implementation details, example outputs, and an evolved feature (credit-score impact) show thorough, functional use of AI rather than superficial mention.
